xxl.connectivity.jama
Class RoussopoulosChenQFSEstimator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.queries.QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator
      xxl.connectivity.jama.RoussopoulosChenQFSEstimator
All Implemented Interfaces:
RangeQuery
public class RoussopoulosChenQFSEstimator
extends QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator
implements RangeQuery

This class provides a selectivity estimator for range queries based upon [RC94]: Chen, Chungmin Melvin Chen. Roussopoulos, Nick. Adaptive Selectivity Estimation Using Query Feedback. ACM Sigmod 1994. p. 161-172, using feedback informations for tuning the selectivity estimation algorithm.

See Also:
QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator, RangeQuery

Constructor Detail

RoussopoulosChenQFSEstimator

public RoussopoulosChenQFSEstimator(int degree,
                                    int sizeGG,
                                    double dmax,
                                    double dmin,
                                    int m,
                                    double alpha)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new Object of this type and initializes the parameters.

Parameters:
degree - degree of the used model function (polynomial)
sizeGG - the size of the entirety
dmax - maximum value of the entirety
dmin - minimum value of the entirety
m - number of true selectivities used for adjusting the algorithm
alpha - used weight
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any given argument exceeds a valid range
Method Detail

invokeModelFunction

protected double invokeModelFunction(double x)
Evaluates the model functions. I.e. the linear combination of the model functions will be evaluated as f(x) = sum_{i=0}^{n} a_i * phi_i (x).

Parameters:
x - function argument
Returns:
function value

invokeModelFunctionIntegral

protected double invokeModelFunctionIntegral(double x)
Evaluates the primitives of the model functions. I.e. the linear combination of the primitives of the model functions will be evaluated as f(x) = sum_{i=0}^{n} a_i * PHI_i (x) = = sum_{i=0}^{n} a_i * int {phi_i (x) dx}.

Parameters:
x - function argument
Returns:
function value

setBeta

public void setBeta(double b)
This method gives the user the possibility to set an importance weight for each query. If the invoke method is called without calling this method before, the importance weight for the query will be set to 1.

Parameters:
b - importance weight for the last estimated query

rangeQuery

public double rangeQuery(Object a,
                         Object b)
Performs an estimation of a given range query.

Specified by:
rangeQuery in interface RangeQuery
Parameters:
a - left object of the range to query (inclusively)
b - right object of the range to query (exclusively)
Returns:
a numerical value to be associated with the query

getSelectivity

protected double getSelectivity(Object query)
Gives the estimated selectivity (absolute) of a query (interval query) calculated with the estimation function. If the estimated selectivity is negative, it will return 0 (as in [PC94] mentioned).

Specified by:
getSelectivity in class QueryFeedbackSelectivityEstimator
Parameters:
query - query to process (must be given as double [] containing left and right border of the interval query to process
Returns:
estimated selectivity

adjust

protected void adjust()
Adjusts the estimation function (processing the query feedback algorithm).

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
